english.segment1: Well, I play an old guitar from a nine till a half past one. I'm just tryin' to make a livin' watchin' everybody else havin' fun. Well, I don't miss much if it happens on a dance hall floor. Mercy, look what just walked through that door
english.segment2: Well, hello T-R-O-U-B-L-E. Tell me what in the world. You doin' A-L-O-N-E. Yeah, say hey, good L double O-K-I-N-G. Well, I smell T-R-O-U-B-L-E.. Yeah
english.segment3: I was a little, bitty baby when my papa hit the skids. Mama had a time tryin' to raise nine kids. She told me not to stare cause it was impolite. She did the best she could to try to raise me right. Cause mama never told me 'bout nothin' like Y-O-U. Bet your mama musta been another good lookin' honey, too
english.segment4: Yeah. Hey, good L double O-K-I-N-G. Well, I smell T-R-O-U-B-L-E..
english.segment6: Well, you're a sweet talkin', sexy walkin', honky tonkin' baby. The men are gonna love ya and the woman gonna hate ya. Remindin' them of everythin' they're never gonna be. May be the beginning of a world war three. Cause the world ain't ready for nothing like Y-O-U. I bet your mama musta been another good lookin' mama, too
english.segment7: Hey, say hey, good L double O-K-I-N-G. Well, I smell T-R-O-U-B-L-E..
english.segment8: I said hey. I said hey. I said hey. I said hey. I said hey (Hey)
